AAV  AAV2012   Zc  -  AAVSO Photometric All-Sky Survey (APASS), Data Release 6                            .                  
AAV                   http://www.aavso.org/apass                                                                             
AAV                   (Note: APASS photometry extracted from UCAC4 catalog; no observations dates are                        
AAV                   given, so a coarse date of 2010 was assumed for all measures. Negative errors mean                     
AAV                   the star was observed on only one night for that magnitude; therefore, the error                       
AAV                   is purely Poisson rather than nightly scatter. Due to aperture method used, APASS                      
AAV                   photometry is only included for pairs wider than 10" (Henden, private comm.)

OH   Oh_2017   Hg  -  Oh, S., Price-Whelan, A.M., Hogg, D.W., Morton, T.D., & Spergel, D.N.               2017AJ....153..257O
OH                    AJ 153, 257, 2017                                                                                      
OH                    (Note: This paper includes many very wide pairs in systems having similar proper                       
OH                    motion and parallax. These systems are comprised of as many as 151 components,                         
OH                    so may more correctly be considered as moving groups rather than multiple stars.                       
OH                    We have adopted criteria to distinguish between "clusters" (i.e., clusters,                            
OH                    associations, or moving groups) and multiple systems, based on the number of                           
OH                    components in the largest known physical multiples and the separations of the                          
OH                    widest known physical binaries. If a group consists of 8 or more members and has                       
OH                    a mean separation greater than 20,000 au, we consider it a "cluster" and its                           
OH                    component pairs are not included in the WDS or its supplement. Accordingly,                            
OH                    approximately 8,000 of the 13,000 pairs in this paper were excluded.)

UC                    & Zacharias, M.I.                 (UCAC4 Catalog)

UC   UC_2013b  Eu  j  Hartkopf, W.I., Mason, B.D., Finch, C.T., Zacharias, N., Wycoff, G.L., & Hsu, D.    2013AJ....146...76H
UC                    AJ 146, 76, 2013                  (UC 301 - 5058)                                                      
UC                    (Relative astrometry is derived from individual measurements, not precessed means.                     
UC                    UCAC aperture magnitudes are listed, unless the duplicity flag indicates a blended                     
UC                    image (a flag value of 30 or higher). Model fit magnitudes are given for both                          
UC                    components if either has such a flag. Model fit magnitudes are indicated by the                        
UC                    letter "f" following the filter information.                                                           
UC                    APASS photometry extracted from UCAC4 catalog is listed under reference AAV2012.                       
UC                    Due to aperture method used, APASS photometry is only included for pairs wider                         
UC                    than 10" (Henden, private comm.) Photometry for pairs wider than 10" which showed                      
UC                    identical values for both components in all filters were removed, as well.

WEN                   Harvard, and 5-inch at Arequipa. No published dates, but date range 1903-1912;                         
WEN                   default date of 1910 added.)
